content:
• Thursday, December 5, 2019

  • Everi -1.9% after pricing 10M-share offering

    • Everi Holdings (NYSE:EVRI) is down 1.9% after hours, adding on to a 7.9% decline in the regular session, after it priced its announced 10M-share offering.
    • The company priced the offering at $11.25/share; it closed today at $11.86.
    • That marks net proceeds of about $107M, to be used to refinance part of existing indebtedness.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:36 PM
  • EPZM

    Epizyme +2.6% as Morgan Stanley joins other bulls

    • Epizyme (NASDAQ:EPZM) is up 2.6% postmarket after its last cautious analyst holdout joined others in the bull column.
    • Morgan Stanley raised its recommendation to Overweight from Equal Weight, where it was a lone holdout.
    • The firm set its price target to $22, implying 44% upside.
    • Along with sell-siders that are Bullish, the stock has a Quant Rating of Bullish.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 PM
  • KODK

    Kodak +8.5% as director buys $11M in shares

    • Kodak (NYSE:KODK) is up 8.5% postmarket after a disclosure that director George Karfunkel purchased more than $11M worth of shares this week.
    • An SEC filing shows Karfunkel bought 4,437,605 shares Tuesday, at an average price of $2.50.
    • That brings his direct beneficial ownership of the stock to 6,706,276 shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM | 11 Comments

  • ULTA, ZM, DOCU and YEXT among notable after hours movers

    • Gainers: DOMO +23.1%. ULTA +9.6%. DOCU +9%. EZPW +8.2%. ZUMZ +8.1%.
    • Losers: YEXT -22.3%. PD -16.8%. KFY -14.5%. ISEE -11%. ZM -7.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • GWRE

    Guidewire -4.6% after downside Q2 revenue outlook

    • Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE) drops 4.6% after the Q1 beats arrived with a downside Q2 forecast that sees revenue of $162-166M versus the $188.08 consensus.
    • The in-line FY20 outlook has revenue of $759-771M compared to the $765.25M estimate.
    • Earnings call started at 5 PM with a webcast here.
    • Press release.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • DOMO

    Domo 24.4% after upside revenue outlook

    • Domo (NASDAQ:DOMO) +24.4% after the Q3 results beat expectations and the Q4 outlook sees upside revenue of $45-46M with an inline loss per share of $0.98-0.94.
    • Q3 subscription revenue grew 24% Y/Y to $37.8M.
    • Billings gained 15% to $44.4M.
    • Net cash used in operating activities improved 47% to $16M.
    • Earnings call started at 5 PM with a webcast here.
    • Press release.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • COO

    Cooper Companies down 8% after hours despite FQ4 beat & guidance raise

    • Cooper Companies (NYSE:COO) fiscal Q4 results:
    • Revenue: $691.6M (+6%), CSI: $509.6M (+6%); CSI: $182.1M (+7%).
    • Net income: $121.0M (+20%); EPS: $2.42 (+20%); non-GAAP EPS: $3.30 (+15%).
    • Fiscal Q1 guidance: Revenue: $638M - 653M; CVI: $480M - 490M; CSI: $158M - 163M; non-GAAP EPS: $2.65 - 2.75.
    • Fiscal 2020 guidance: Revenue: $2,767M - 2,817M from $2,635M - 2,655M; CVI: $2,070M - 2,100M from $1,966M - 1,976M; CSI: $697M - 717M from $669M - 679M; non-GAAP EPS: $12.60 - 13.00 from $12.27 - 12.35.
    • Shares down 8% after hours.
    • Previously: The Cooper Companies EPS beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (Dec. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • YEXT

    Yext -22% on earnings miss, wider loss forecasts

    • Yext (NYSE:YEXT) tumbles 21.8% after the Q3 report misses earnings estimates and comes with a set of downside forecasts.
    • For FY20, Yext sees revenue of $296.5-298.5M (consensus: $301.1M) and loss per share of $0.51-0.49 (consensus: $0.42).
    • The downside Q4 outlook has revenue of $79-81M and a $0.15-0.13 loss per share.
    • Earnings call starts at 5 PM with a webcast here.
    • Press release.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 3 Comments
  • ICON

    Iconix Brand -11% after former execs indicted

    • Iconix Brand Group (NASDAQ:ICON) is down 10.44% in AH trading. Bloomberg reports that the company's ex-CEO was indicted for fraud.
    • Earlier this afternoon, Iconix disclosed a SEC settlement over an accounting probe, but a separate complaint was filed also filed by the SEC against ex-CEO Neil Cole and former COO Seth Horowitz.
    • Previously: Iconix settles accounting case with SEC (Dec. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 18 Comments
  • OKTA

    Okta dips despite upside quarter

    • Okta (NASDAQ:OKTA) -3.4% reports Q3 beats with upside Q4 guidance that sees $155-156M in revenue with a loss per share of $0.05 to $0.04.
    • The FY outlook sees $574-575M with a loss per share of $0.35-0.34.
    • Q3 subscription revenue was up 48% on the year to $144.5M.
    • Billings grew 42% Y/Y in Q3 to $175.6M.
    • Remaining performance obligations totaled $1.03B. Current RPO was $515.9M.
    • Gross margin was 77.8% versus the 76.7% consensus. Operating margin was -5.3% compared to -6.1% in last year's quarter.
    • R&D expenses soared 52% Y/Y to $41.8M.
    • Earnings call starts at 5 PM with a webcast here.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 17 Comments
  • AOBC

    American Outdoor Brands +8% after strong guidance

    • American Outdoor Brands (NASDAQ:AOBC) reports FQ2 revenue ($154.4M vs. $150M consensus), adjusted EBITDA ($20.9M vs. $20.2M) and gross margin rate ahead of expectations.
    • Looking ahead, AOBC sees full-year revenue of $680M to $700M vs. a prior view for $630M to $650M and $644M consensus.
    • CEO update: "During the second quarter, we remained focused on innovation throughout our company. In firearms, we began shipping into the channel a major new product, which will be available to our consumer customers on December 12. In both our firearms and our outdoor products and accessories businesses, we prepared a large number of exciting new products for launch at SHOT Show in January 2020."
    • AOBC +8.32% AH.
    • Previously: American Outdoor Brands EPS beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Dec. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • CRWD

    CrowdStrike -2.3% despite best-ever quarter

    • CrowdStrike Holdings (NASDAQ:CRWD) is down 2.3% after hours following a Q3 earnings report with a better-than-expected loss and raised guidance for the full year.
    • Revenue rose 88% overall (to $125.1M) and subscription revenue nearly doubled, hitting $114.2M.
    • Annual recurring revenue also rose 97%, to $501.7M.
    • Operating loss (non-GAAP) narrowed to $16.5M from a year-ago loss of $28.6M. Similarly, net loss shrank to $13.4M from a year-ago loss of $28.8M.
    • Cash from operations was $38.6M vs. a year-ago use of $3.6M; free cash flow was $7M, vs. the prior year's -$13.1M.
    • For Q4, it's guiding to total revenue of $135.9M-$138.6M (vs. consensus for $127.2M) and EPS of -$0.09 to -$0.08. (above consensus for -$0.11).
    • For the full year, it's raising expectations for revenues to $465.2M-$468M (above expectations for $450.2M), and sees EPS of -$0.53 to -$0.52 (above consensus for -$0.63). Liquidity increased to $833.7M as of quarter's end.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 47 Comments
  • ZUMZ

    Zumiez gains after earnings beat

    • Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) is up 2.55% in AH trading after comparable sales rise 5.5% in Q3 to top the consensus mark of +4.2%. The retailer says it saw solid full-price selling in all the geographic regions it sells in.
    • Gross margin improved 90 bps to 35.9% of sales during the quarter.
    • Zumiez management expressed confidence about the holiday quarter, with comparable sales up 3.3% QTD through December 3.
    • Previously: Zumiez EPS beats by $0.15, beats on revenue (Dec. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • DOCU

    DocuSign -4.3% despite beats, upside Q4 view

    • DocuSign (NASDAQ:DOCU) slides 4.3% after hours following the upside Q3 report with a Q4 forecast that sees revenue above consensus at $263-267M.
    • For FY, DOCU sees revenue of $962-966M.
    • Q3 billings were up 36% Y/Y to $269.4M, beating the consensus by $1M.
    • Subscription revenue was up 41% to $238M, and professional services increased 28% to $11.4M.
    • Negative FCF was $14.1M versus the $4.3M loss in last year's quarter.
    • Earnings call starts at 4:30 PM with a webcast here.
    • Press release.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 15 Comments
  • ZUMZ

    Zumiez EPS beats by $0.15, beats on revenue

    • Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ): Q3 GAAP EPS of $0.75 beats by $0.15.
    • Revenue of $264.02M (+6.1% Y/Y) beats by $3.16M.
    • Shares +4.71%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • CLDR

    Cloudera EPS beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

    • Cloudera (NYSE:CLDR): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of -$0.03 beats by $0.03; GAAP EPS of -$0.29 misses by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $198.29M (+66.6% Y/Y) beats by $9.21M.
    • Shares +7%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 22 Comments
  • ULTA

    Ulta Beauty +7% after comp sales beat

    • Ulta Beauty (NASDAQ:ULTA) edges past comparable sales expectations with a 3.2% gain in Q3 vs. +3.1% consensus.
    • Transactions were up 2.3% during the quarter and average ticket was 0.9% higher.
    • Gross margin was up 40 bps Y/Y to 37.1% of sales vs. 36.8% consensus. The retailer points to improvement in merchandise margins driven by marketing and merchandising strategies and leverage of fixed store costs, which was partially offset by investments in salon services.
    • Looking ahead, Ulta Beauty sees revenue growth of +10% vs. a prior view for +9% to +12% and 10.4% consensus. EPS $11.93 to $12.03 is anticipated vs. $11.91 consensus.
    • ULTA +6.60% AH.
    • Previously: Ulta Beauty EPS beats by $0.10, misses on revenue (Dec. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 64 Comments
  • AOBC

    American Outdoor Brands EPS beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • American Outdoor Brands (NASDAQ:AOBC): Q2 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.02; GAAP EPS of $0.02 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $154.39M (-4.5% Y/Y) beats by $4.89M.
    • Shares +3.87%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 3 Comments
  • DOMO

    Domo EPS beats by $0.16, beats on revenue

    • Domo (NASDAQ:DOMO): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of -$0.85 beats by $0.16; GAAP EPS of -$1.05 beats by $0.13.
    • Revenue of $44.77M (+21.5% Y/Y) beats by $2.96M.
    • Shares +4.26%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 4 Comments
  • OKTA

    Okta EPS beats by $0.05, beats on revenue

    • Okta (NASDAQ:OKTA): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of -$0.07 beats by $0.05; GAAP EPS of -$0.53 misses by $0.12.
    • Revenue of $153.04M (+45.0% Y/Y) beats by $9.16M.
    • Shares +2%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 14 Comments
  • ISEE

    Iveric bio launches equity offering; shares down 13% after hours

    • IVERIC bio (NASDAQ:ISEE) commences a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares down 13% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 4 Comments
  • ULTA

    Ulta Beauty EPS beats by $0.10, misses on revenue

    • Ulta Beauty (NASDAQ:ULTA): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of $2.23 beats by $0.10; GAAP EPS of $2.25 beats by $0.12.
    • Revenue of $1.68B (+7.7% Y/Y) misses by $10M.
    • Shares +7.56%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 13 Comments
  • WOW

    WideOpenWest at month's high amid CEO share purchase

    • WideOpenWest (NYSE:WOW) is up 7.4% and tagged its highest point in over a month after a disclosure that CEO Teresa Elder bought shares.
    • Elder purchased 12,672 shares at an average price of $5.92 on Tuesday, according to a Form 4 filing.
    • The move brings her direct beneficial ownership to 1,054,188 shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • TNP

    Tsakos Energy rises on charter extension for LNG carrier

    • Tsakos Energy Navigation (TNP +3.5%) says it has extended the contract for one of its LNG carriers with "one of the industry's top names" at a higher rate for at least one year and possibly as long as three years, starting in Q1 2020.
    • The company expects the extension and new increased rate will generate ~$30M of gross revenues.
    • "TEN's diversified fleet of crude, product, shuttle tankers and LNG carriers, provides management with the flexibility to choose the most accretive business in each segment, in today's strong tanker market environment," the company says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • CEL

    Cellcom closes tender expecting 307M shekels in proceeds

    • Cellcom (CEL +2.1%) has closed its public tender for ordinary shares, series 3 options and series 4 options.
    • The company got offers for total consideration of about 650M shekels (about $187.6M) and accepted a portion.
    • It will issue 30.6M ordinary shares, 7.04M series 3 options and 6.43M series 4 options for 1,021 shekels per unit.
    • Net consideration to be received is about 307M shekels (about $88.6M), with the offering expected to close Dec. 8.
    • With the participation of Cellcom's controlling shareholder, it will hold about 46.2% of issued and outstanding share capital, and 48.5% of voting rights.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM

  • SecureWorks and Foresight Autonomous among Tech gainers; Elastic and Pintec Technology among losers

    • Gainers: SecureWorks (NASDAQ:SCWX) +24%. Foresight Autonomous (NASDAQ:FRSX) +14%. Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND) +12%. SeaChange International (NASDAQ:SEAC) +11%. Resonant (NASDAQ:RESN) +10%.
    • Losers: Elastic (NYSE:ESTC) -18%. Pintec Technology (NASDAQ:PT) -10%. Sunworks (NASDAQ:SUNW) -9%. Intelsat (NYSE:I) -8%. TTEC (NASDAQ:TTEC) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • WLL

    Whiting Petroleum cut at KeyBanc on continued missteps, high leverage

    • Whiting Petroleum (WLL -7.3%) drags along near its lowest levels of the year as KeyBanc downgrades shares to Sector Weight from Overweight, saying the company likely will continue to struggle with execution.
    • Much of WLL's execution problem is due to weaker than expected well results in the Bakken, high declines at Redtail and much softer commodity price realizations in oil and natural gas liquids, says KeyBanc analyst Leo Mariani.
    • WLL's financial leverage is well above peers, Mariani says, and notes the company plans to pay down debt with asset sales, "which may be tough right now."
    • Despite cost-cutting initiatives, Mariani thinks the company could have limited success in achieving its goal of improving free cash flow.
    • WLL's average Sell Side Rating, Seeking Alpha Authors' Rating and Quant Rating are all Neutral.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 11 Comments
  • ETSY

    Etsy lower after first bear pops up on Wall Street

    • Morgan Stanley lowers Etsy (ETSY -2.7%) to an Underweight rating after having the online retailer slotted at Equal-weight.
    • The firm cautions on the slowing gross merchandise sales trend for Etsy in comparison to consensus expectations and valuation.
    • MS is the only Wall Street player with a Sell-equivalent rating on Etsy. On Seeking Alpha, presented a bearish thesis last month.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 9 Comments

  • Bull sees 2U as acquisition target

    • KeyBanc analyst Arvind Ramnani sees 2U (TWOU +1%) as the next M&A target after Instructure agreed to be acquired by Thomas Bravo for $47.60/share in cash.
    • The analyst notes that TWOU is trading at 2.1x EV/CY20 revenue, while INST's takeout multiple was 5.6x.
    • Ramnani doesn't expect a buyer to pay the same premium for 2U as the Instructure deal, but a similar multiple offer would amount to about $63/share.
    • KeyBanc maintains an Overweight rating and $31 target on TWOU. The company has a Bullish average SA Author's rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM

  • Quintana Energy Services and Energy Fuels among Energy/Materials gainers; KLX Energy Services and Paringa Resources among losers

    • Gainers: Quintana Energy Services (NYSE:QES) +15%. Energy Fuels (NYSEMKT:UUUU) +13%. Lightbridge (NASDAQ:LTBR) +13%. Cypress Energy Partners (NYSE:CELP) +8%.Americas Silver (NYSEMKT:USAS) +8%.
    • Losers: KLX Energy Services (NASDAQ:KLXE) -20%. Paringa Resources (NASDAQ:PNRL) -8%. Northern Oil and Gas (NYSEMKT:NOG) -7%. Eldorado Gold (NYSE:EGO) -7%. Whiting Petroleum (NYSE:WLL) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • EXPR

    Express sails to six-month high

    • Express (EXPR +28.5%) has extended on its post-earnings gain and is now trading at its highest level since early March.
    • The company notes that Q3 results reflected some of the new ideas and strategic direction. Express management expects the initiatives to continue to positively impact results in Q4 and beyond.
    • Previously: Express EPS beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (Dec. 5)
    • Previously: Express 15% higher on earnings beat (Dec. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • DSGX

    Descartes Systems -5.4% after EPS miss

    • Descartes Systems (NASDAQ:DSGX) is down 5.4% after yesterday's Q3 results beat on revenue but missed on EPS.
    • Stephens says the business is still performing well despite the tough macro backdrop but notes that the valuation is at the high end of its historical range.
    • The firm maintains an Equal Weight rating and raises the target from $40 to $42. The company has a Neutral Quant rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • PDCO

    Patterson up 13% on FQ2 earnings beat, guidance raise

    • Patterson Companies (PDCO +13%) fiscal Q2 results:
    • Net sales: $1,418.7M (+1.0%); Dental: $564.6M (+4.1%); Animal Health: $848.2M (-1.0%).
    • Net loss: ($33.1M) (-214.5%); non-GAAP net income: $36.6M (+1.0%); loss/share: ($0.35) (-212.9%); non-GAAP EPS: $0.39 (flat).
    • Cash flow ops (6 mo.): ($14.7M) (-107.3%).
    • Fiscal 2020 guidance: EPS: $0.42 - 0.52 from $1.13 - 1.23; non-GAAP EPS: $1.36 - 1.46 from $1.33 - 1.43.
    • The company has reached an agreement in principle with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Western District of Virginia to resolve its investigation into alleged sales of prescription medications by its animal health unit to unlicensed persons.
    • Previously: Patterson EPS beats by $0.04, revenue in-line (Dec. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • SCWX

    Secureworks +21% post Q3 earnings beat; names new CFO

    • Secureworks up (SCWX +20.5%) as the company says that revenue, gross margin, adjusted EBITDA and cash flow were strong in Q3 and exceeded expectations.
    • For Q4 2020, the Company expects revenue of $138M - $140M, with GAAP EPS loss of $0.13 - $0.12 and non-GAAP net loss per share of $0.01 to $0.00.
    • The company also updated FY 2020 guidance and sees sales of ~$549M - $551M, and adjusted EPS loss of $0.03 - $0.02
    • Forecasts adjusted EBITDA of $11M - $12M and cash flow from operations of $45M - $50M.
    • Secureworks appoints Paul Parrish as its new CFO, effective Dec. 9, 2019.
    • He brings over 25 years of experience and most recently he served as CFO at CIOX Health
     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM

  • Hovnanian among industrial gainers; Plug Power and GrafTech International among losers

    • Gainers: Air Industries (NYSEMKT:AIRI) +19%. Hovnanian (NYSE:HOV) +17%. Powell Industries (NASDAQ:POWL) +13%. AZZ (NYSE:AZZ) +13%.
    • Losers: Newater Technology (NASDAQ:NEWA) -18%. GrafTech International (NYSE:EAF) -10%. NF Energy Saving (NASDAQ:BIMI) -8%. Coda Octopus (NASDAQ:CODA) -6%. Plug Power (NASDAQ:PLUG) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • PBR

    OPEC membership not an option for Brazil, Petrobras CEO says

    • Joining OPEC "is not an option that's being considered by the Brazilian government," says Petrobras (PBR +3.3%) CEO Roberto Castello Branco, after Brazil Pres. Bolsonaro recently welcomed an informal invitation to join the cartel.
    • The state oil company says the government should not have the power to determine production levels of private operators.
    • Yesterday, the CEO said PBR plans to pay $34B in dividends over the next five years as it cuts debt and sells assets to shore up its finances.
    • PBR should pay $3B in dividends next year and raise the amount after 2021, when a reduction of gross debt to $60B triggers an internal rule for higher payments, Castello Branco said at a conference in New York.
    • The plan marks a major shift for the company, which recently has kept payouts at or near the bare minimum required by law in Brazil, and would mark the latest step by Castello Branco to win back the trust of investors.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM

  • CBL & Associates Properties and Banco de Chile among financial gainers; At Home Group leads losers

    • Gainers: CBL & Associates Properties (NYSE:CBL) +11%. Banco de Chile (NYSE:BCH) +7%. Banco Santander-Chile (NYSE:BSAC) +5%.
    • Losers: At Home Group (NYSE:HOME) -36%. BRP Group (NASDAQ:BRP) -10%. Weidai (NYSE:WEI) -9%. Garrison Capital (NASDAQ:GARS) -5%. China Rapid Finance (NYSE:XRF) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM

  • CLVS, AUPH, ESTC and HOV among midday movers

    • Gainers: Aurinia Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AUPH) +95%.
    • Duluth (NASDAQ:DLTH) +32%.
    • Atreca (NASDAQ:BCEL) +29%.
    • Express (NYSE:EXPR) +27%.
    • DermTech (NASDAQ:DMTK) +24%.
    • Marinus Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MRNS) +23%.
    • SecureWorks (NASDAQ:SCWX) +21%.
    • Proteostasis Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PTI) +20%.
    • Air Industries (NYSEMKT:AIRI) +18%.
    • Hovnanian Enterprises (NYSE:HOV) +16%.
    • Losers: Sage Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SAGE) -58%.
    • Akers Biosciences (NASDAQ:AKER) -41%.
    • At Home Group (NYSE:HOME) -35%.
    • BioLineRx (NASDAQ:BLRX) -26%.
    • Clovis Oncology (NASDAQ:CLVS) -24%.
    • Millendo Therapeutics (NASDAQ:MLND) -22%.
    • Newater Technology (NASDAQ:NEWA) -17%.
    • Elastic (NYSE:ESTC) -17%.
    • Kirkland's (NASDAQ:KIRK) -16%.
    • Apellis Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:APLS) -15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • RYTM

    Rhythm Pharma (+4%) completes enrollment in setmelanotide obesity study

    • Rhythm Pharmaceuticals (RYTM +4.3%) is up on below-average volume in response to its announcement that enrollment has been completed in a Phase 3 clinical trial evaluating setmelanotide in Bardet-Biedl and Alström syndrome patients who are moderately or severely obese.
    • The primary endpoint of the 32-subject study is the proportion of participants who achieve at least a 10% reduction in body weight from baseline at week 52.
    • Topline data should be available in in Q4 2020/Q1 2021.
    • Setmelanotide activates a protein called melanocortin 4 receptor (MC4R) that plays a key role in controlling appetite.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • KR

    Kroger slides as analysts question execution

    • Kroger (KR -4.3%) says it plans to divest its stake in Lucky's Market on its view that the amount of investment the business would need wouldn't create a good return for the company.
    • In the opinion of some, it's another example of the company going in several different directions at once.
    • "Kroger’s three-year plan was underwhelming when it was unveiled two years ago, and since then the company hasn’t consistently impressed with its execution. Kroger is undoubtedly a busy company, but it’s not clear all the hustle is making it a better one," writes Bloomberg Opinion columnist Sarah Halzack.
    • Analysts note that many Kroger initiatives aren't paying off with margins just yet. JPMorgan's Ken Goldman says Kroger's margin numbers in Q3 were surprisingly disappointing amid the easy comparisons, less competitive pricing environment and possible help from hurricanes during the quarter compared to a year ago.
    • Previously: Kroger -2% after earnings miss (Dec. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 6 Comments
  • SNSS

    Sunesis Pharma down 24% on disappointing vecabrutinib data

    • Nano cap Sunesis Pharmaceuticals (SNSS -24.2%) slumps on a 20x surge in volume in apparent response to an abstract on an ongoing Phase 1/2 clinical trial evaluating BTK inhibitor vecabrutinib in patients with B cell blood cancers. The data will be presented at ASH on Sunday, December 8.
    • Across cohorts 1-5, there were no responders. 10 patients showed stable cancer but all others (n=19) discontinued due to cancer progression.
    • A year ago, the company reported safety data on 11 patients from the same study at ASH. Shares sold off over 30% at the time.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 2 Comments
  • TAN

    Trade court blocks Trump move to kill solar tariff loophole

    • Solar names (NYSEARCA:TAN) are volatile following news that Pres. Trump's attempt to remove a loophole that shields some Chinese solar panels from tariffs was blocked by the U.S. Court of International Trade.
    • The trade court issued a preliminary injunction freezing the administration's move to eliminate the provision that exempted bifacial panels from duties.
    • While a boon to the industry at large, the court's ruling is a setback for companies that make panels in the U.S., including First Solar (FSLR -3.1%) and SunPower (SPWR -2.2%).
    • The ruling came in response to a complaint filed by Invenergy LLC which challenged the government's withdrawal of the exclusion; in its ruling, the court says it granted the injunction because "Invenergy is likely to succeed on the merits."
    • Among other relevant tickers: CWEN +0.3%, NRG -1.8%, VSLR +2.1%, CSIQ +3%, JKS +3.8%, RUN +1.2%, ENPH -3.7%, SEDG -3.1%.

  • BIIB

    Biogen's aducanumab showed mixed results in Alzheimer's studies

    • Results from two Phase 3 clinical trials, EMERGE and ENGAGE, evaluating Biogen's (BIIB -2.9%) aducanumab in patients with early Alzheimer's disease (AD) produced different outcomes. The data were presented at the Clinical Trials on Alzheimer's Disease Conference in San Diego.
    • In EMERGE, the high dose arm met the primary endpoint of the change from baseline in CDR-SB score at week 78 compared to placebo (p=0.0101) as well as the secondary endpoints of ADAS-Cog 13 and ADCS-ADL-MCI at week 78. The other secondary endpoint, MMSE score, was not met in the larger dataset analysis but did based on the final dataset (p=0.0493). The low dose arm missed all endpoints.
    • In ENGAGE, both the low dose and high-dose arms failed to achieve the primary and all secondary endpoints in either dataset.
    • The company plans to file a U.S. application based on the totality of the data.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM | 37 Comments

  • ACAD

    Acadia Pharma up 16% on pimavanserin data in dementia psychosis

    • ACADIA Pharmaceuticals (ACAD +16%) is up on almost double normal volume in reaction to positive results from a Phase 3 clinical trial, HARMONY, evaluating Nuplazid (pimavanserin) for the treatment of dementia-related psychosis, a Breakthrough Therapy-tagged indication. The data were presented at the Clinical Trials on Alzheimer's Disease Conference in San Diego.
    • The study met the primary endpoint of a statistically significant reduction (2.8-fold) in the risk of relapse compared to placebo. A key secondary endpoint, reduction (2.2-fold) in the risk of discontinuation for any reason, was also met.
    • The company plans to meet with the FDA in H1 2020 to discuss a supplemental marketing application.
    • The FDA approved the atypical antipsychotic in April 2016 for Parkinson's disease psychosis.
